comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The Ordnance Survey Historical Map shows that the Imperial and Adelphi hotels were both on the site where the modern Tower Hotel is built. So, closer to the river than you have it now, the far side of Lombard Street. Adelphi Quay is still so named, even though the hotel name is gone.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: The Imperial was where the Tower Hotel is today. The Imperial is the building on the right in this old view This photo was taken shortly after the demolition of the Adelphi,

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] Thanks chaps! Will move them all down towards the river...
